translation.en: [woman] When I was a kid, it was, like, have you ever had Lucky Charms,
translation.ko: 어릴 적이 어땠냐면요 '럭키 참스' 시리얼을 부었는데

translation.en: and you pour out the Lucky Charms and you get, like, a bowl of cereal and three marshmallows,
That's what it felt like to me, that there were three Asian-American marshmallows.
translation.ko: 아시아계 미국인 캐릭터란 제게 그런 느낌이었어요

translation.en: The Yellow Ranger in Power Rangers...
The Yellow Power Ranger...
Data from The Goonies was one of my favorites. Margaret Cho on All-American Girl...
Michelle Kwan in figure skating. I thought maybe Lois Lane could be mixed race,
translation.ko: - 피겨스케이팅 선수 미셸 콴 - 로이스 레인이 저처럼 혼혈일지

translation.en: -like I am. -Captain Planet.
[interviewer] Captain Planet is Asian?
Not Asian, but there was an Asian character
who had a dolphin friend.
The Baby-Sitters Club is a series of books that came out in the 80's and 90's.
[Sarah Kuhn] It follows a group of 13-year-old middle schoolers
who are friends
and they decide to form a business
translation.ko: 아이들은 동네에서 베이비시터 사업을 벌이기로 결심하죠

translation.en: by babysitting the local kids in their neighborhood.
They're really concerned about, um, quality child care...
translation.ko: 다들 훌륭한 보육을 하겠다고 무지 신경 쓰는데

translation.en: which now seems, um... a little odd that they-- that was like their passion: babysitting.
translation.ko: 지금 돌아보면 왜 하필 베이비시팅인지 이상하긴 하죠

translation.en: There's always a new incident or adventure.
There's fun drama. There's boy drama, of course.
translation.ko: 재미있는 사건도 있고 남자애가 연루되기도 하죠

translation.en: Stacey's going through an issue with her dad.
What's this jealousy when you think Mary has a new best friend?
translation.ko: 메리앤에게 새 단짝 친구가 생겼다니 질투심이 샘솟기도 하죠

translation.en: Going shopping, babysitting, spending time with her friends,
translation.ko: 쇼핑도 가고, 아이들도 돌보고 친구들과 만나 놀고

translation.en: going on cruises to Disney World.
The Baby-Sitters Club was my childhood.
translation.ko: '베이비시터 클럽'은 어릴 적 추억 그 자체예요

translation.en: I had... not only a really big collection of Baby-Sitters Club books at home,
translation.ko: '베이비시터 클럽' 책을 집에 엄청 모아둔 걸로 모자라

translation.en: I also would check them out at the library periodically
and even, like, check out old favorites.
I voraciously read through a good chunk,
primarily through the Scholastic Book Club orders.
translation.ko: 거의 어린이 책 출판사에서 주문해 읽었을 거에요

translation.en: [sighs] Y'all know what that is, I mean...
I was reading them. My friends were reading them.
translation.ko: 저뿐만 아니라 주변 친구들도 다 읽었어요

translation.en: Once I got into it, it was like... drugs for me.
translation.ko: 일단 빠지고 난 다음엔 거의 중독돼다시피 했어요

translation.en: We've got the sleeping bag.
I've got a bag. Um, I had a necklace.
I had t-shirts. There were dolls.
I had a CD-ROM game.
I spent many hours on it.
We would call each other by those character names.
We would try to dress like those characters.
Of course I was Claudia.
"Suddenly, I sat up. All I could think about
were Milky Way bars and Ring-Dings and Oreos.
Those were going to be the subject of my next art project.
I could see it so clearly, the series of pop art pieces:
translation.ko: '눈앞에 선명하게 그려졌다 팝아트 작품을 만드는 거다'

translation.en: 'Junk-Food Fantasy by Claudia Kishi.'
The idea was brilliant. I couldn't wait to get started."
translation.ko: '그야말로 훌륭했다 얼른 만들고 싶어 좀이 쑤셨다'

translation.en: [Phil Yu] Claudia Kishi is vice president of The Baby-Sitters Club.
She's also Japanese American.
She loves junk food. She loves art.
Kooky, eclectic, and... ahead of her time.
I loved that she had hollowed-out books.
translation.ko: 안에 간식을 숨기려고 속이 빈 책을

translation.en: I feel like that's something I still want, is, like, hollowed-out books to-- to hide all of my candy.
translation.ko: 갖고 다니는 점이 참 좋았어요 지금도 좀 가지고 싶어요

translation.en: [Yumi Sakugawa] She's cool enough to have her own landline in her bedroom,
translation.ko: 얼마나 쿨한지 자기 방에 따로 유선전화까지 있었죠

translation.en: unheard of when you're a 13-year-old girl.
translation.ko: 제가 13살 때는 상상도 못 할 일이었어요

translation.en: Usually... um, the Asian character or the woman of color character
is the one you feel like you have to be, right?
If you're playing Harry Potter, you have to be Cho Chang.
translation.ko: '해리 포터'라면 전 초 챙을 해야 하죠

translation.en: Whereas I feel like Claudia is the one everyone seems to want to be.
translation.ko: 하지만 클로디아는 모두가 하고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: "I love to dress in a way that some people
here in Stoneybrook might call...
translation.ko: '여기 스토니브룩에 사는 사람들이 보기엔' '대담하게 입는 게 좋다'

translation.en: outrageous."
"At the moment I'm wearing lavender plaid cuffed pants
with suspenders..." "White tights with clocks on them."
"I was wearing a man's paisley vest I found at a yard sale..."
"Huge pretend emeralds..." "Electric pink ankle boots."
"I've got earrings shaped like Christmas tree lights
translation.ko: '크리스마스 트리 전구 장식 모양 귀걸이도 있는데'

translation.en: that blink on and off."
Oh, my God.
"Was it too much? I shook my head.
I looked great."
[Sarah Kuhn] Claudia's style to me is very, like, tween girl meets Asian auntie.
translation.ko: 꼭 10대 초반 소녀와 아시아계 이모의 조합 같았어요

translation.en: I feel like Claudia... knew what hipster fashion was gonna be 20 years later.
translation.ko: 20년 뒤 힙스터 패션을 클로디아가 예견한 거죠

translation.en: For an Asian American, or any woman of color character,
translation.ko: 아시아계 미국인을 포함한 모든 유색인종 여성 등장인물은

translation.en: to be the cool one is so unusual.
She is just a really awesome character
who I felt like kind of busted through all the model minority stereotypes.
translation.ko: 편견을 제대로 깬 훌륭한 캐릭터라고 생각해요

translation.en: "My family is conservative, but I'm wild.
My sister and I have next to nothing in common.
She's super smart and likes school.
My parents think she's wonderful.
I wouldn't admit this to just anybody,
but I have a feeling that I'm a big disappointment to my parents."
That was such a mood.
That's like... That was such a, like... a big mood for, like--
This is why I related to Claudia so much.
Janine is like the kind of daughter that every...
that I felt that, like, my mom would've wanted, and I was definitely not.
translation.ko: 저희 엄마도 바랐을 자식이죠 하지만 전 그렇지 못했어요

translation.en: And I... would constantly... have this specter of... the perfect daughter...
translation.ko: 완벽한 딸의 이미지가 언제나 절 무겁게 눌렀죠

translation.en: kind of... hanging over me 'cause I felt very aware that I was not this person.
translation.ko: 저는 영영 그런 딸이 못 될 걸 알고 있으니까요

translation.en: I felt like Claudia.
I wanted to follow my heart and do creative things.
translation.ko: 마음 가는 대로 창의성을 발휘하고 싶었죠

translation.en: I wanted to do art. I wanted to draw. I wanted to write.
translation.ko: 창작하고, 그림을 그리고 글을 쓰고 싶었어요

translation.en: Claudia was so... unapologetic about... who she was.
translation.ko: 클로디아는 스스로에 대해 전혀 부끄러워하지 않아요

translation.en: She really showed that you could be an artist, that you could be creative.
translation.ko: 제게 저도 예술가가 되어 창작할 수 있다고 말해줬죠

translation.en: Claudia Kishi was this role model that just... hit me exactly right.
Like, "Oh, this is like a puzzle piece that fits right into my heart."
translation.ko: 제 마음에 딱 들어맞는 퍼즐 조각이었죠

translation.en: "'The Lowells are prejudiced,' said Kristy in a rush.
'Claud, they didn't like you because you're Japanese.
translation.ko: '클로디아, 네가 일본계란 이유로 안 좋아하는 거야'

translation.en: Jessi, Mrs. Lowell wouldn't even let you in her house because you're African-American.'
My mouth dropped open. I could feel my hands trembling and my cheeks burning.
translation.ko: '입이 떡 벌어졌다 손이 떨리고 얼굴에 피가 몰렸다'

translation.en: 'That's-- That's not fair!'"
Congratulations, Claudia.
You just learned a few things about good old-fashioned racism.
I thought about the cover of "Keep Out, Claudia!"
and I remember, like, it was her standing outside the door
with these Trump-looking white kids
translation.ko: 트럼프같이 생긴 백인 아이들이 클로디아를 노려보고 있죠

translation.en: looking at her judgingly. I thought it was like,
translation.ko: 트럼프같이 생긴 백인 아이들이 클로디아를 노려보고 있죠 '표지가 엄청 현실적이라면 어떨까?'싶더라고요

translation.en: "What if these covers were really truthful?"
I just thought, like, it'd be a great way to talk about some microaggressions.
translation.ko: 미묘한 인종 차별을 다룰 훌륭한 방법 아니겠어요?

translation.en: Things that Asians have to deal with every day,
that Claudia probably would have to deal with, but they never addressed in the books.
translation.ko: 클로디아도 겪었겠지만 책에는 한 번도 나오지 않아요

translation.en: There is definitely that quality of... um...
I guess, othering, for sure, where that a lot of these stories are being told
translation.ko: 동양인을 외부인 취급 하죠 백인 소녀 관점에서 벌어지는 일들이니까요

translation.en: from the perspectives of young white girls.
They, you know, somewhat problematically made a point to describe her
as always having almond-shaped eyes and... um...
translation.ko: 아몬드 모양 눈에 새까만 머리라고 표현하죠

translation.en: jet-black hair and super beautiful skin, even though she eats tons of junk food.
translation.ko: 게다가 불량식품을 그렇게 먹는데 피부는 매끄럽다고 하고요

translation.en: [Phil] First time I read someone described as "almond-shaped eyes."
translation.ko: '아몬드 모양 눈'이란 표현은 거기서 처음 봤어요

translation.en: And I was like, "What does that even mean?"
In terms of racial representation it definitely, like...
How do I put this? I noticed that-- most of the people were white.
[CB Lee] When you don't see yourself in media, when you don't see mirrors of yourself,
translation.ko: 미디어에서 스스로를 닮은 인물상을 찾을 수 없다면

translation.en: you go on thinking, "I'm broken," or... "I'm not normal," or "I don't exist."
translation.ko: '난 비정상이야, 존재하지 않아' 이런 생각을 갖게 돼요

translation.en: These thoughts, they're kind of subconscious, but they, um...
They're pervasive, especially when you go on thinking that the world...
is-- When you perceive the world... as a world without you in it.
I remember, um, the person with the really heavy cartoonish accent.
translation.ko: 말투가 꼭 만화 캐릭터 같은 등장인물도 있었고

translation.en: And a lot of disposable side characters and things like that that.
That sort of generalized sense of being
othered in media,
of being the perpetual foreigner, of never being American.
translation.ko: 결국은 외국인 취급이고 절대 미국인이 될 수 없죠

translation.en: And I do remember that manifesting in school
with every kid asking me where I was from, um,
translation.ko: 만나는 아이들마다 어느 나라에서 왔냐고 묻고

translation.en: or pulling their eyes back to sort of, like, make fun of me.
So, I definitely remember, um, how it affected me in real life.
translation.ko: 그런 경험이 제 인생에 얼마나 큰 영향을 줬는지 기억해요

translation.en: As someone who grew up, like, with-- with a Thai mom and a white dad, um,
translation.ko: 태국인 엄마와 백인 아빠 밑에서 자란 사람으로서

translation.en: the Asian narratives I saw didn't always jive with my experience,
translation.ko: 아시아를 다룬 미디어가 늘 제 경험과 일치하진 않았어요

translation.en: which contributed to my questions of identity.
translation.ko: 그 탓에 저는 정체성에 늘 의문을 품고 살았죠

translation.en: So, seeing someone like Claudia,
translation.ko: 그러다 클로디아가 자기 길을 개척해가는 걸 보고

translation.en: who was kind of forging her own path, definitely
translation.ko: 그러다 클로디아가 자기 길을 개척해가는 걸 보고 그제야 제 정체성을 조금은 알 것 같았어요

translation.en: helped me feel more connected to, um, my own identity.
translation.ko: 그제야 제 정체성을 조금은 알 것 같았어요

translation.en: Just knowing there's not one way to be an Asian person.
translation.ko: 아시아계 인물상이란 하나만 있는 게 아니에요

translation.en: I can just be me and that's fine.
"I pulled out my box of 64 Crayola crayons with the sharpener.
I sighed with happiness, and then I began to draw.
translation.ko: '그리고 행복하게 한숨 쉰 뒤 그림을 그렸다'

translation.en: My beautiful butterfly was finished."
"'Claudia!' Said Miss Packet sternly.
'Is this some kind of joke?'
I could not answer her. If I had, I would have cried."
translation.ko: '나는 대답하지 않았다 입을 열면 울 것 같았다'

translation.en: So, Mimi hears about this incident. Mimi, of course, this...
translation.ko: 이 일을 미미 할머니가 알게 돼요 미미 할머니는...

translation.en: awesome grandma who totally gets Claudia,
translation.ko: 클로디아와 너무 잘 통하는 멋진 할머니예요

translation.en: who embraces Claudia's artsy side, and she's not gonna let this slide.
translation.ko: 클로디아 창의성을 아끼시죠 그래서 할머니가 나서요

translation.en: So she goes up to the teacher.
"She said, 'Miss Packet,
I would like you please to respect my Claudia's intelligence and imagination.
You asked the children to draw themselves the way they see themselves,
and my Claudia sees herself as a free spirit, like a butterfly.
translation.ko: '우리 클로디아는 스스로를 자유로운 나비로 보는 거예요'

translation.en: So, that is what she drew.'"
Mic drop! Fuck, yes!
[laughs] Sorry, I didn't mean to swear. Um...
Go, Mimi.
It was such a beautiful story, especially... since Asian American... children,
translation.ko: 아름다운 이야기잖아요 특히 아시아계 미국인 아이들은

translation.en: they grow up being told by their elders to-- to not stand out too much,
translation.ko: 집안 어른들에게 나서지 말란 말을 들으며 자라거든요

translation.en: to not create waves, to fit in with the crowd.
translation.ko: 분란 일으키지 말고 눈에 띄지도 말라고요

translation.en: For an Asian American person I felt like it was... extra special,
translation.ko: 우리 본모습을 남들 앞에서 숨기지 않아도 된단 메시지가

translation.en: the idea that we can... be our true selves and not... hide it from the world.
translation.ko: 아시아계 미국인인 제게 정말 소중하게 와닿았어요

translation.en: Oh, my God.
In 2013, I made a Zine called
"Claudia Kishi: My Asian American and Female Role Model of the 90's."
translation.ko: '클로디아 키시, 1990년대 내 아시아계 미국인 여성 롤모델'

translation.en: It was just so exciting to see how it struck a chord
with other Asian American women readers.
It was sort of, like, magical to realize we'd all been having
the same experience, you know, in different towns, everywhere reading these books,
translation.ko: 이 책을 읽으며 똑같이 공감을 했다니 신기했죠

translation.en: before we had a way of connecting with each other.
You can always tell when somebody is a Claudia Kishi.
translation.ko: '너 클로디아 키시 같다' 라는 말은 칭찬이에요

translation.en: There's a certain swagger and there's definitely...
There's definitely a feeling of camaraderie
when you see another Asian girl that maybe doesn't fit that standard stereotype and,
at the end of the day none of us really fit the stereotype.
translation.ko: 그런 고정 관념에 들어맞는 아이는 사실 한 명도 없어요

translation.en: Her legacy is that she's moved beyond just this character.
translation.ko: 클로디아는 단순한 캐릭터 그 이상으로 진화했어요

translation.en: Kids who grew up in the 90's are now adults
making their way into the world, creating their own works.
translation.ko: 사회에 진출해 자기만의 작품을 만들어내고 있죠

translation.en: I am a comic book artist,
illustrator, all-around interdisciplinary artist.
[Phil Yu] "Angry Asian Man" is a blog I started back in 2001.
I'm working on The Baby-Sitters Club as a series with Netflix.
translation.ko: 넷플릭스 '베이비시터 클럽' 드라마 제작에 참여 중이에요

translation.en: I write books and comic books
about Asian American superheroines.
I'm the graphic novelist currently working on The Baby-Sitters Club adaptations.
I'm the author of The Sidekick Squad series.
It's about a group of queer teens that take on a corrupt government agency.
translation.ko: 10대 퀴어들이 부패한 정부 기관을 뒤집는 얘기죠

translation.en: "Fashion Forecasts" is a futuristic collection of intergenerational,
intersectional Asian American fashion designs.
translation.ko: 공유하는 패션에 관하여 다루는 미래적 콜렉션이에요

translation.en: Probably the biggest theme that connects my work is--
I call it "Asian girls having fun."
I love to tell stories about friendship, fantasy,
translation.ko: 우정과 판타지 그리고 함께 힘을 합치면

translation.en: being more than you are when you come together.
It's a way to have conversations about who you are as Asian Americans.
translation.ko: 아시아계 미국인 정체성에 대해 이야기하는 방법이죠

translation.en: The girls are gonna be dealing with issues happening now.
translation.ko: 현재 논란이 되는 이슈도 다를 거예요

translation.en: You know, transgender rights, prejudices against same-sex parents...
translation.ko: 트랜스젠더 권리 동성 부모에 관한 편견...

translation.en: The main characters are Chinese and Vietnamese like me,
and she's bisexual like me.
[Gele] There's always gonna be a challenge to make sure
that we're seen as more than just a fad or a sidekick.
translation.ko: 조수 정도로 취급당하는 일이 없도록 언제나 분투할 겁니다

translation.en: [Sarah] You can be a main character. Have your own story.
translation.ko: 우리도 주인공이 될 수 있고 나만의 이야기를 쓸 수 있어요

translation.en: You can tell your own story however you want.
[Phil] At some point I realized
translation.ko: 남에게 허락받거나 남이 대신 얘기해줄 필요가

translation.en: I didn't need permission to tell it or for someone else to tell it for me.
translation.ko: 남에게 허락받거나 남이 대신 얘기해줄 필요가 없다는 사실을 깨달았어요

translation.en: I wanna see people like me doing cool shit. [laughs]
translation.ko: 저 같은 사람들이 멋진 일을 해내는 걸 보고 싶어요

translation.en: [CB Lee] I remember hanging out with friends on the playground.
Imagine, like, five or six Asian American girls.
translation.ko: 아시아계 미국인 여자애 대여섯 명이 있다고 상상해보세요

translation.en: We had that fight about who gets to be Claudia, because...
translation.ko: 누가 클로디아 할 건지를 두고 싸우고는 했어요

translation.en: you know, we're so thirsty to be seen.
We're thirsty for those crumbs of representation.
We're tired of just having crumbs. We want the whole cookie.
translation.ko: 이제 부스러기는 지겨워요 쿠키를 통째로 먹을래요

translation.en: We're gonna go out and bake our own cookies
and put them out so everyone can enjoy them.
translation.ko: 모두가 즐길 수 있도록 세상에 내놓을 거라고요
